template.textblock: Chapter I
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>TOM</alias>!"
No answer.
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>TOM</alias>!"
No answer.
"What's gone with <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>that boy</alias>, I wonder? You <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>TOM</alias>!"
No answer.

The old lady pulled spectacles down and looked over them about the room; then put them up and looked out under them. seldom or never looked through them for so small a thing as a boy; they were state pair, the pride of heart, and were built for "style," not service-- could have seen through a pair of stove-lids just as well. looked perplexed for a moment, and then said, not fiercely, but still loud enough for the furniture to hear:
"Well, I lay if I get hold of you I'll--"

<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> did not finish, for by this time <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> was bending down and punching under the bed with the broom, and so <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> needed breath to punctuate the punches with. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> resurrected nothing but the cat.
"I never did see the beat of that <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>boy</alias>!"

<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> went to the open door and stood in it and looked out among the tomato vines and "jimpson" weeds that constituted the garden. No <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>. So <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> lifted up <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> voice at an angle calculated for distance and shouted:
"Y-o-u-u <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>TOM</alias>!"

There was a slight noise behind <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> and <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> turned just in time to seize a small <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>boy</alias> by the slack of <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> roundabout and arrest <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> flight.
"There! I might 'a' thought of that closet. What you been doing in there?"
"Nothing."
"Nothing! Look at your hands. And look at your mouth. What is that truck?"
"I don't know, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>aunt</alias>."
"Well, I know. It's jam--that's what it is. Forty times I've said if you didn't let that jam alone I'd skin you. Hand me that switch."
The switch hovered in the air--the peril was desperate--
"My! Look behind you, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>aunt</alias>!"

The old <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>lady</alias> whirled round, and snatched <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 gdescriptor>skirts </gdescriptor>out of danger. The <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>lad</alias> fled on the instant, scrambled up the high board-fence, and disappeared over it.

<getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>aunt</alias> <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 nameFirst> stood surprised a moment, and then broke into a gentle laugh.

"Hang the boy, can't I never learn anything? Ain't played me tricks enough like that for me to be looking out for by this time? But old fools is the biggest fools there is. Can't learn an old dog new tricks, as the saying is. But my goodness, never plays them alike, two days, and how is a body to know what's coming? 'pears to know just how long can torment me before I get my dander up, and knows if can make out to put me off for a minute or make me laugh, it's all down again and I can't hit a lick. I ain't doing my duty by that boy, and that's the Lord's truth, goodness knows. Spare the rod and spile the child, as the Good Book says. I'm a laying up sin and suffering for us both, I know. 's full of the Old Scratch, but laws-a-me! 's my own dead sister's boy, poor thing, and I ain't got the heart to lash , somehow. Every time I let off, my conscience does hurt me so, and every time I hit my old heart most breaks. Well-a-well, man that is born of woman is of few days and full of trouble, as the Scripture says, and I reckon it's so. 'll play hookey this evening, * and [* Southwestern for "afternoon"] I'll just be obleeged to make work, tomorrow, to punish . It's mighty hard to make work Saturdays, when all the boys is having holiday, but hates work more than hates anything else, and I've got to do some of my duty by , or I'll be the ruination of the child."

<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> did play hookey, and <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> had a very good time. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> got back home barely in season to help Jim, the small colored boy, saw next-day's wood and split the kindlings before supper--at least <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> was there in time to tell <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> adventures to Jim while Jim did three-fourths of the work. <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>'s younger brother (or rather half-brother) <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650 shortName> was already through with <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650)> part of the work (picking up chips), for <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650)> was a quiet boy, and had no adventurous, trouble-some ways.

While <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> was eating <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> supper, and stealing sugar as opportunity offered, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 formalName> asked <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> questions that were full of guile, and very deep--for <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> wanted to trap <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> into damaging revealments. Like many other simple-hearted souls, it was <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> pet vanity to believe <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> was endowed with a talent for dark and mysterious diplomacy, and <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> loved to contemplate <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> most transparent devices as marvels of low cunning. Said <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)>:
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>, it was middling warm in school, warn't it?"
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 gdescriptor>Yes'm.</gdescriptor>"
"Powerful warm, warn't it?"
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 gdescriptor>Yes'm.</gdescriptor>"
"Didn't you want to go in a-swimming, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>?"

A bit of a scare shot through <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>--a touch of uncomfortable suspicion. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> searched <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 formalName>'s face, but it told <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> nothing. So <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> said:
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 gdescriptor>No'm</gdescriptor>--well, not very much."

The old <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>lady</alias> reached out <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> hand and felt <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>'s shirt, and said:

"But you ain't too warm now, though." And it flattered <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> to reflect that <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> had discovered that the shirt was dry without anybody knowing that that was what <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> had in her mind. But in spite of <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)>, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> knew where the wind lay, now. So <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> forestalled what might be the next move:
"Some of us pumped on our heads--mine's damp yet. See?"

<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 formalName> was vexed to think <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> had overlooked that bit of circumstantial evidence, and missed a trick. Then <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> had a new inspiration:
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>, you didn't have to undo your shirt collar where I sewed it, to pump on your head, did you? Unbutton your jacket!"

The trouble vanished out of <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>'s face. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> opened <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> jacket. <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> shirt collar was securely sewed.
"Bother! Well, go 'long with you. I'd made sure you'd played hookey and been a-swimming. But I forgive ye, . I reckon you're a kind of a singed cat, as the saying is--better'n you look. This time."

<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> was half sorry <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> sagacity had miscarried, and half glad that <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> had stumbled into obedient conduct for once.
But <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650 nameFirst> said:
"Well, now, if I didn't think you sewed <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> collar with white thread, but it's black."
"Why, I did sew it with white! <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>!"

But <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> did not wait for the rest. As <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> went out at the door <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> said:
"<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650 alias>Siddy</alias>, I'll lick you for that."

In a safe place <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> examined two large needles which were thrust into the lapels of <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> jacket, and had thread bound about them--one needle carried white thread and the other black. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> said:

"<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)>'d never noticed if it hadn't been for <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650 shortName>. Confound it! sometimes <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> sews it with white, and sometimes <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> sews it with black. I wish to gee-miny <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)>'d stick to one or t'other--I can't keep the run of 'em. But I bet you I'll lam <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650 shortName> for that. I'll learn <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329537650)>!"

<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> was not the <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>Model Boy </gdescriptor>of the village. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> knew the <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>model boy </gdescriptor>very well though--and loathed <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>him</gdescriptor>.

Within two minutes, or even less, <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> had forgotten all <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> troubles. Not because <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> troubles were one whit less heavy and bitter to <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> than <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>a man's are to a man</gdescriptor>, but because a new and powerful interest bore them down and drove them out of <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> mind for the time--just as men's misfortunes are forgotten in the excitement of new enterprises. This new interest was a valued novelty in whistling, which <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> had just acquired from a negro, and <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> was suffering to practise it undisturbed. It consisted in a peculiar bird-like turn, a sort of liquid warble, produced by touching the tongue to the roof of the mouth at short intervals in the midst of the music--the reader probably remembers how to do it, if he has ever been a boy. Diligence and attention soon gave <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> the knack of it, and <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> strode down the street with <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> mouth full of harmony and <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> soul full of gratitude. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> felt much as an astronomer feels who has discovered a new planet--no doubt, as far as strong, deep, unalloyed pleasure is concerned, the advantage was with the <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>boy</alias>, not the astronomer.

The summer evenings were long. It was not dark, yet. Presently <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> checked <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> whistle. A stranger was before <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)>--a boy a shade larger than <getHimselfHerself(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)>. A new-comer of any age or either sex was an impressive curiosity in the poor little shabby village of <tom_sawyer_template_geoloc_1453329471591 name>. This boy was well dressed, too--well dressed on a week-day. This was simply as astounding. His cap was a dainty thing, his close-buttoned blue cloth roundabout was new and natty, and so were his pantaloons. He had shoes on--and it was only Friday. He even wore a necktie, a bright bit of ribbon. He had a citified air about him that ate into <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>'s vitals. The more <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> stared at the splendid marvel, the higher <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> turned up <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> nose at his finery and the shabbier and shabbier <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> own outfit seemed to <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> to grow. Neither <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>boy </gdescriptor>spoke. If one moved, the other moved--but only sidewise, in a circle; they kept face to face and eye to eye all the time. Finally <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> said:
"I can lick you!"
"I'd like to see you try it."
"Well, I can do it."
"No you can't, either."
"Yes I can."
"No you can't."
"I can."
"You can't."
"Can!"
"Can't!"
An uncomfortable pause. Then <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> said:
"What's your name?"
"'Tisn't any of your business, maybe."
"Well I 'low I'll make it my business."
"Well why don't you?"
"If you say much, I will."
"Much--much--much. There now."
"Oh, you think you're mighty smart, don't you? I could lick you with one hand tied behind me, if I wanted to."
"Well why don't you do it? You say you can do it."
"Well I will, if you fool with me."
"Oh yes--I've seen whole families in the same fix."
"Smarty! You think you're some, now, don't you? Oh, what a hat!"
"You can lump that hat if you don't like it. I dare you to knock it off--and anybody that'll take a dare will suck eggs."
"You're a liar!"
"You're another."
"You're a fighting liar and dasn't take it up."
"Aw--take a walk!"
"Say--if you give me much more of your sass I'll take and bounce a rock off'n your head."
"Oh, of course you will."
"Well I will."
"Well why don't you do it then? What do you keep saying you will for? Why don't you do it? It's because you're afraid."
"I ain't afraid."
"You are."
"I ain't."
"You are."
Another pause, and more eying and sidling around each other. Presently they were shoulder to shoulder. <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> said:
"Get away from here!"
"Go away yourself!"
"I won't."
"I won't either."

So they stood, each with a foot placed at an angle as a brace, and both shoving with might and main, and glowering at each other with hate. But neither could get an advantage. After struggling till both were hot and flushed, each relaxed <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>his </gdescriptor>strain with watchful caution, and <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> said:
"You're a coward and a pup. I'll tell my big brother on you, and he can thrash you with his little finger, and I'll make him do it, too."
"What do I care for your big brother? I've got a brother that's bigger than he is--and what's more, he can throw him over that fence, too." [Both brothers were imaginary.]
"That's a lie."
"Your saying so don't make it so."
<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> drew a line in the dust with <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> big toe, and said:
"I dare you to step over that, and I'll lick you till you can't stand up. Anybody that'll take a dare will steal sheep."
The new boy stepped over promptly, and said:
"Now you said you'd do it, now let's see you do it."
"Don't you crowd me now; you better look out."
"Well, you said you'd do it--why don't you do it?"
"By jingo! for two cents I will do it."

The new boy took two broad coppers out of his pocket and held them out with derision. <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> struck them to the ground. In an instant both <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 gdescriptor>boys </gdescriptor>were rolling and tumbling in the dirt, gripped together like cats; and for the space of a minute they tugged and tore at each other's hair and clothes, punched and scratched each other's nose, and covered themselves with dust and glory. Presently the confusion took form, and through the fog of battle <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> appeared, seated astride the new boy, and pounding him with <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> fists. "Holler 'nuff!" said <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)>.
The boy only struggled to free himself. He was crying--mainly from rage.
"Holler 'nuff!"--and the pounding went on.
At last the stranger got out a smothered "'Nuff!" and <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> let him up and said:
"Now that'll learn you. Better look out who you're fooling with next time."

The new boy went off brushing the dust from his clothes, sobbing, snuffling, and occasionally looking back and shaking his head and threatening what he would do to <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> the "next time he caught <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> out." To which <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> responded with jeers, and started off in high feather, and as soon as <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> back was turned the new boy snatched up a stone, threw it and hit <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> between the shoulders and then turned tail and ran like an antelope. <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> chased the traitor home, and thus found out where he lived. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> then held a position at the gate for some time, daring the enemy to come outside, but the enemy only made faces at <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> through the window and declined. At last the enemy's mother appeared, and called <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> a bad, vicious, vulgar child, and ordered <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> away. So <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> went away; but <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> said <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> "'lowed" to "lay" for that boy.

<getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> got home pretty late that night, and when <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> climbed cautiously in at the window, <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> uncovered an ambuscade, in the person of his <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>aunt</alias>; and when <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> saw the state <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> clothes were in <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> resolution to turn <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> Saturday holiday into captivity at hard labor became adamantine in its firmness.
Chapter II

Saturday morning was come, and all the summer world was bright and fresh, and brimming with life. There was a song in every heart; and if the heart was young the music issued at the lips. There was cheer in every face and a spring in every step. The locust-trees were in bloom and the fragrance of the blossoms filled the air. <tom_sawyer_template_loc_1453332520979 name>, beyond the village and above it, was green with vegetation and it lay just far enough away to seem a Delectable Land, dreamy, reposeful, and inviting.

<tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> appeared on the sidewalk with a bucket of whitewash and a long-handled brush. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> surveyed the fence, and all gladness left <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> and a deep melancholy settled down upon <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> spirit. Thirty yards of board fence nine feet high. Life to <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> seemed hollow, and existence but a burden. Sighing, <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> dipped <getHisHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> brush and passed it along the topmost plank; repeated the operation; did it again; compared the insignificant whitewashed streak with the far-reaching continent of unwhitewashed fence, and sat down on a tree-box discouraged. Jim came skipping out at the gate with a tin pail, and singing Buffalo Gals. Bringing water from the town pump had always been hateful work in <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName>'s eyes, before, but now it did not strike <getHimHer(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> so. <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> remembered that there was company at the pump. White, mulatto, and negro boys and girls were always there waiting their turns, resting, trading playthings, quarrelling, fighting, skylarking. And <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210)> remembered that although the pump was only a hundred and fifty yards off, Jim never got back with a bucket of water under an hour--and even then somebody generally had to go after him. <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 shortName> said:
"Say, Jim, I'll fetch the water if you'll whitewash some."
Jim shook his head and said:

"Can't, Mars Tom. Ole missis, tole me I got to go an' git dis water an' not stop foolin' roun' wid anybody. say spec' Mars Tom gwine to ax me to whitewash, an' so tole me go 'long an' 'tend to my own business-- 'lowed 'd 'tend to de whitewashin'."
"Oh, never you mind what said, Jim. That's the way always talks. Gimme the bucket--I won't be gone only a minute. won't ever know."

"Oh, I dasn't, <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>Mars Tom</alias>. Ole <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>missis</alias> <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)>'d take an' tar de head off'n me. 'Deed <getHeShe(tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029)> would."

"! never licks anybody--whacks 'em over the head with thimble--and who cares for that, I'd like to know. talks awful, but talk don't hurt--anyways it don't if don't cry. Jim, I'll give you a marvel. I'll give you a white alley!"
Jim began to waver.
"White alley, Jim! And it's a bully taw."
"My! Dat's a mighty gay marvel, I tell you! But <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329448210 alias>Mars Tom</alias> I's powerful 'fraid ole <tom_sawyer_template_char_1453329428029 alias>missis</alias>--"

Conclusion

SO endeth this chronicle. It being strictly a history of a boy, it must stop here; the story could not go much further without becoming the history of a man. When one writes a novel about grown people, he knows exactly where to stop--that is, with a marriage; but when he writes of juveniles, he must stop where he best can.

Most of the characters that perform in this book still live, and are prosperous and happy. Some day it may seem worth while to take up the story of the younger ones again and see what sort of men and women they turned out to be; therefore it will be wisest not to reveal any of that part of their lives at present.
